entry.title: [WW] Anything to watch out for besides oxybenzone (potential endocrine disruptor) in
entry.content:
Anything to watch out for besides oxybenzone (potential endocrine disruptor) in sunscreens? Titanium dioxide was ruled [unsafe](https://www.efsa.europa.eu/en/news/titanium-dioxide-e171-no-longer-considered-safe-when-used-food-additive) as a food colorant, doesn't say anything about topical use however (this [study](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3423755/) suggests it should not be too bad.
I've found [EWG](https://www.ewg.org/sunscreen/report/the-trouble-with-sunscreen-chemicals/)'s post but am unsure how reliable of a source they are.
